reply.question: 1. Does the app declare the collection of data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the collection of data.

reply.analysis: The Privacy Policy clearly states that Uptime collects personal information, indicating the declaration of data collection.
reply.reference: If you decide to download and use the Uptime App, we will collect information such as your name, phone number and/or email address to enable you to use Uptime’s services, including the Uptime App and the Uptime Site. URL: https://uptime.app/privacy-policy/

source_documents.excerpt:
Privacy Policy
[Modified as of 16 June 2025]
Personal Data Protection
Uptime App Ltd. (“Uptime”) is committed to ensuring user privacy. Therefore, we have tried to answer any questions you may have below. This Privacy Policy applies to all individuals who use the Uptime application (the “Uptime App”) or appear in- or in relation to the resources provided by it, and the Uptime website (the “Uptime Site”). Please note, this Privacy Policy also applies to other processing of personal data by Uptime...

information such as identification numbers, other online identifiers, electronic location data, and your behaviour online.
You will find the Personal Data we use below. Also, Uptime has appointed a Data Protection Officer who oversees the collection and protection of your Personal Data. Our Data Protection Officer Aphaia Ltd can be reached by email at dpo@aphaia.co.uk.
What Personal Information About Customers Does Uptime Collect and Why?
If you are just visiting Uptime to look around and check ...

the disclosure of certain categories of personal information to third parties for their own direct marketing purposes in the preceding calendar year, if any. You may request this information by contacting us at privacy@uptime.app and indicate in the email subject line, “California Shine The Light Request.” Please include your mailing address, state of residence and email address with your request.
For California residents under the age of 18 and registered users of the Uptime App or the Uptime S...

to your rights, please email privacy@uptime.app. We may need to request specific information from you when you exercise your rights to confirm your identity and to speed up our response. We may not be able to fulfil your request if we are not able to identify you.
Our policy towards children
Uptime is a General Audience Site and the Uptime Services are only available to persons aged 13 and over.
The Uptime Services are not directed to persons under 13 and we do not knowingly collect personal inf...

reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app collects information such as name, phone number, email address, social media information, user's employer-provided data, profile picture, username, about you section, and external links.

reply.analysis: The answer is derived from the section describing the types of information collected by the app, including personal data, employer-provided data, and additional user-provided data.
reply.reference: The app collects information such as name, phone number, email address, social media information, user's employer-provided data, profile picture, username, about you section, and external links. URL: https://uptime.app/privacy-policy/

reply.question: 3. Does the app declare the purpose of data collection and use?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the purpose of data collection and use.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that the app declares the purposes of data collection and use, ensuring transparency for users.
reply.reference: Here are the types of information we gather and the technical means we use to gather it: Information You Give Us. Uptime receives and stores any information you provide in relation to the Uptime Services... Do Not Track
We currently do not honour browser-based Do-Not-Track signals.
Changes to this policy
We may amend this Privacy Policy from time to time in order that it accurately reflects the regulatory environment and our own data collection and disclosure practices. Accordingly, you should review this policy periodically. When we change this Privacy P...

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the user can opt out of data collection and delete data by making a request to Uptime via email.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy states that users can request the deletion of their personal information by contacting Uptime via email, indicating that users have the option to opt out of data collection and delete their data.
reply.reference: To make a 'request to know' or request to delete your personal information, send us an e-mail at privacy@uptime.app. URL: https://uptime.app/privacy-policy/

source_documents.excerpt:
latest state-of-the-art technology to ensure that your information is fully protected.
What Choices Do I Have?
If you have any questions or objection as to how we collect and process your personal information, please contact us at privacy@uptime.app or our Data Protection Officer directly at dpo@aphaia.co.uk
How Long Do We Keep Your Personal Information?
We keep your personal information as long as may be necessary to enable your continued use of Uptime Services. In case of resource-related pers...

the disclosure of certain categories of personal information to third parties for their own direct marketing purposes in the preceding calendar year, if any. You may request this information by contacting us at privacy@uptime.app and indicate in the email subject line, “California Shine The Light Request.” Please include your mailing address, state of residence and email address with your request.
For California residents under the age of 18 and registered users of the Uptime App or the Uptime S...

elsewhere.
Right to object: You may ask us at any time to stop processing your personal information where we process your data based on our legitimate interests, provided no compelling legitimate grounds for further processing exist.
Rights in relation to automated decision-making and profiling: You have the right to be free from decisions based solely on automated processing of your personal information, including profiling, unless this is necessary in relation to a contract between you and us ...

you can request a copy of that information by emailing privacy@uptime.app.
Right to rectification: If your personal information is inaccurate or incomplete, you are entitled to ask that we correct or complete it. If we shared your personal information with others, we will tell them about the correction where possible.
Right to erasure: You may ask us to erase your personal information in some circumstances, such as where we no longer need it or you withdraw your consent.
Right to restrict proces...

reply.question: 5. Does the app share data with third parties?
reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that the app does not presently sell any personal information to third parties for any purpose.
reply.reference: Uptime does not presently sell any personal information to third parties for any purpose. URL: https://uptime.app/privacy-policy/

source_documents.excerpt:
does not presently sell any personal information to third parties for any purpose.
To make a “request to know” or request to delete your personal information, send us an e-mail at privacy@uptime.app. (Please put either “Request to Know” or “Request to Delete” in the subject heading of your email.) We will honour these requests for US individuals whether or not you would qualify as a California consumer under the CCPA.
We will confirm receipt of your request within 10 days along with a descriptio...

recommendation and searches.
Does Uptime Share Your Personal Information?
Personal data that we process may be shared with analytics, communications, database, authentication, marketing, content and user management, testing, cloud infrastructure and other cloud services providers, recruitment and HR services providers. If you have redeemed a bulk subscription offer, we may also share information regarding a user’s registration and a user's cumulative usage of the Uptime App to the company that p...

the disclosure of certain categories of personal information to third parties for their own direct marketing purposes in the preceding calendar year, if any. For California residents under the age of 18 and registered users of the Uptime App or the Uptime S...

reply.question: 6. If the app shares data with third parties, what third parties does the app share data with?

answer.full_answer: The app shares data with analytics, communications, database, authentication, marketing, content and user management, testing, cloud infrastructure, and other cloud services providers, as well as recruitment and HR services providers. Additionally, information may be shared with companies that provided bulk subscription offers.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states the various third parties with whom the app shares data, including analytics, communications, marketing, cloud services, and recruitment providers, among others.
reply.reference: The app shares data with analytics, communications, database, authentication, marketing, content and user management, testing, cloud infrastructure and other cloud services providers, recruitment and HR services providers. If you have redeemed a bulk subscription offer, we may also share information regarding a user’s registration and a user's cumulative usage of the Uptime App to the company that provided the offer. URL: https://uptime.app/privacy-policy/
